title: Why Discord timestamps matter
summary: Share event times that automatically adjust to each viewer's timezone, reducing confusion and missed meetings.
content: Discord timestamps convert to each viewer's local time. With a single code like <t:1234567890:f>, everyone sees a local date without math. This saves organizers from manually listing timezones and reduces missed events.

title: Formatting tips for chat
summary: Pick between short and long date formats, or use relative timestamps for countdown-style messages.
content: Use <t:1234567890:d> for short dates and <t:1234567890:f> for long ones. Relative timestamps like <t:1234567890:R> give readers a live countdown with no refresh required.

title: Keeping collaborators in sync
summary: Use UNIX timestamps for automation or bots, and the generator for human-friendly previews in chat.
content: Bots work best with raw UNIX timestamps. Pair them with the timestamp generator when you need to share previews in chat or docs, so humans and scripts stay aligned.
